meanings.definition: A punctuation mark ( ) used to set off nonessential or supplementary information within a sentence.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, the parenthesis helps provide additional details.
meanings.sent2: She added a parenthesis to explain the unfamiliar term.
meanings.sent3: The parenthesis in the story revealed a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a parenthesis, adding joy to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The parenthesis acted like a side note, clarifying the main point.

meanings.definition: Either of a pair of curved marks ( ) used to enclose a word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to identify the parenthesis in the sentence.
meanings.sent2: He placed a parenthesis around the name of the book.
meanings.sent3: The parenthesis seemed to hug the word tightly.
meanings.sent4: The parenthesis around the word created a sense of containment.
meanings.sent5: The parenthesis embraced the phrase, highlighting its importance.
